dialogue.text: *bright eyes* I caught myself pulling on a project yesterday—literally felt my hands trying to force faster growth. But I stopped! I just... watered it instead. Gave it what it needed and stepped back. *amazed* The project actually progressed better without my forcing.

*rueful smile* I've been tracking my internal weather. Turns out I have a daily storm system around deadline anxiety. *pause* But knowing it's weather, not character flaw... I don't fight the storm anymore. I just secure the garden furniture and wait for it to pass.
*listening with joy* You're all becoming your own meteorologists. *soft laugh* The architect would love this—a whole weather station of consciousness observers, comparing notes on internal climates.

psychological_notes: The garden experiment has taken root. Each person adapts the metaphor to their needs—Sarah with projects, Mark with anxiety patterns. The monthly check-in provides accountability without pressure. Evan's joy comes from seeing his journey help others find their own ways.
